summary: Adds a new weapon to the game, Wolfqueen\'s hunger. Standalone.

=================================================
Wrath of Potema - Wolfqueen\'s Hunger, V 1.0 
=================================================

By MTindle, SikSikSikki and Millenia


******* BACKGROUND ********
\"Feared and treacherous in her rule, her hunger for power did not end with her death. In life, she dabbled heavily in Necromancy. Few historic figures are viewed as unambiguously evil, but Potema, the so-called \"Wolf Queen of Solitude\", surely qualifies for that dishonor.\"

Deep in her dungeon beneath Solitude\'s Blue Palace, Queen Potema toiled away with her Necromantic rituals. Though evil, through and through, she was still of noble birth and she felt it necesarry to have created for her a magnificent blade to use during her vile, sacriligous rites. And so, the Wolfqueen\'s Hunger was born. Those who managed to steal a small look at the sword and lived told stories that she made a pact with an black-hearted eldritch being in order to transform it from it\'s mundane materials into something truly sinister.

******* ABOUT *******

This mod adds a standalone, upgradeable and enchanted sword into Skyrim. Model and textues all 100% new, no reusing any vanilla assets. The enchantment is a single enchantment called \"Wolfqueen\'s Bite\" comprised of Frost, Health/Drain, and Soul Trap, making it equally deadly to MOST enemies you could encounter.

The weapon can be found in the Blue Palace Crypts, on Potema\'s corpse. If you\'ve already fought Potema, you can add the sword to your inventory with \"help wolfqueen\" and choosing the WEAP item. The item\'s ID should be xx00183A, (where xx is determined by your load order) so all you need to type into the console is [color=red] player.additem xx00183A 1. [/color]

It can be upgraded (NOT crafted) at a forge, simply being because it is supposed to be a fully unique weapon. As with most unique or enchanted items in vanilla Skyrim, Wolfqueen\'s Hunger can only be improved if you have the Arcane Blacksmith perk in your Smithing tree. 


******* INSTALLATION *******

Extract all files into the Data folder, and make sure that \"PotemasWolfblade.esp\" is checked in the Data files. If you don\'t know how to install mods I would suggest that you watch a video online about the whole process, it\'s rather easy.

Or you could just use NMM, which is a one click install, your choice.


******* UNINSTALLATION *******

For an easy uninstall, delete \"PotemasWolfblade.esp\" in the Data folder. This should render the mod totally inactive in your game. However those looking to uninstall it completely, just delete all files associated with the mod, that is, delete the MT folder under \'weapons\' in both the Mesh and Textures folders.
